Name of faculty: Sciences Department: Microbiology
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   Program: B.Sc.Microbiology Sem 3              Type: DSC-5
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Subject: Control of Microorganisms                      NaN
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         Credit: 04 Total learning hours: 60
Course description: The control of microbial growth is necessary in many practical situations,\rthus significant advances in agriculture, medicine, and food science have been made through\rstudy of this area of microbiology. Control of microorganisms is essential so as to prevent the\rtransmission of diseases & infection, stop decomposition and spoilage, and prevent unwanted\rmicrobial contamination. Therefore, controlling microbial growth is important in medical field,\rpharmaceutical and biotechnology industries, academic research, and food industry. Ever since\rmicrobes were shown to cause diseases, different techniques have been invented to control their\rspread.                      NaN
                                                                                                                                                Student learning outcome:\rCompare between disinfectants, antiseptics, and sterilants.\rDescribe the principles of controlling the presence of microorganisms through physical\rand chemical agents, that can eliminate or suppress microbial life.\rThe basis of chemotherapeutic control.\rMode of action of narrow and broad-spectrum antibiotics on gram-positive and gram-\rnegative bacteria.\rMechanism for development of antibiotic resistance and microbial susceptibility.\rMethods for determination of microbial susceptibility.                      NaN

Name of faculty: Science Department: Microbiology
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Program: B. Sc. Microbiology Sem 3              Type: DSC-6
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Subject:Microbial Taxonomy                      NaN
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Credit: 04 Total learning hours: 60
                                                                                                                                           Course description:\rCourse aimed to deliver insights about tools, techniques, strategies and methodologies to\rclassify the microorganisms. Course will also provide detailed knowledge of bacterial and\rarchaeal groups and comprehensive knowledge of protozoa, fungi, algae and virus.                      NaN
Student learning outcome:\rBy the end of this course, student will\rAcquire the knowledge about the basis of microbial classification.\rDevelop the understanding about three domains of life\rExplore detailed features and characteristics of bacteria\rLearn archaeal taxonomy, metabolism and features of archaea.\rUnderstand the classification, major features of important members of protist, fungi,\ralgae and viruses.                      NaN

Name of faculty: Science Department: Environmental Science
                                              Program: B. Sc. Sem 3 Type: SEC-1
                                    Subject: Applied Environmental Microbiology
                                        Credit: 04+ 02 Total learning hours: 60
                                                      Student learning outcome:
                    Basic understanding of microbiology of air, water and soil
                             Knowing microbial hazards of environmental origin
                                           Knowing treatment of drinking water
                              Having basic concept of indicator microorganisms
 Learning sampling and cultural methods for the detection of microorganisms in
                                                          environmental samples

Name of faculty: Science Department: Microbiology
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Program: B.Sc. Microbiology Sem 3              Type: DSC-3
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     Subject: Food and Dairy Microbiology                      NaN
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               Credit: 02 Total learning hours: 30
                                                                                                              Course description:\rThis paper covers the principles of food fermentation and the role of beneficial microbes; the\rrole of microorganisms and food spoilage; pathogenic microorganisms,infection and\rintoxication, the principles to control microbial growth; as well as food safety and quality\rmanagement. Provide students with theoretical knowledge and practical abilities required to\rwork in the food industry, research centers, and food-related national and international\rorganizations.                      NaN
Student learning outcome:\r●Important pathogens and spoilage microorganisms in foods and the conditions,\runder which they will grow, conditions under which the important pathogens are\rcommonly inactivated, killed or made harmless in food.\r●Principles involving food preservation and understand the role and significance of\rmicrobial inactivation, adaptation and environmental factors on growth and\rresponse of microorganisms in various environments.\r●Principles of food science to control and assure the quality of food products and\rsafety standards to be followed in a food and Dairy industry.                      NaN
